newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan prosecutors arrest DKB vice president-NHK.
newsitem.headline: Japan prosecutors arrest DKB vice president-NHK.

text.p: Prosecutors on Friday arrested Dai-ichi Kangyo Bank vice president Ichiro Fujita and an another bank official on suspicion of making illegal loans to a racketeer, media reports said.

Friday's arrests bring to 10 the number of DKB officials apprehended in connection with the payoff scandal. Six others have been arrested, including a former Nomura Securities president and the "sokaiya" corporate racketeer at the heart of the affair.

On Tuesday, four former DKB executives were arrested on suspicion of making illicit loans to a racketeer, and half of the 40 board members at DKB, one of Japan's leading commercial banks, resigned in a shakeup which included the naming of a new president.
Prosecutors said 39 separate loans, totalling 8.8 billion yen ($77.1 million), were believed to have been made through Daiwa Shinyo, a non-bank financial firm affiliated with DKB.
